business.headline: Nissan to cut 20,000 jobs as losses mount and sales drop: ReportNissan recently warned that it expects a record net loss of 700-750 billion yen ($4.74–$5.08 billion) for the last financial year, mainly due to impairment charges.

ITR filing 2025: 6 Must-know tips before you file your tax returnBefore you even think about filing your tax return, make sure your Aadhaar is linked to your PAN. Also, choosing the correct ITR form is important. Filing the wrong one may lead to rejection of your return.

Sensex jumps nearly 3,000 points as India-Pakistan ceasefire fuels relief rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,975.43 points to close at 82,429.90, while the NSE Nifty50 added 916.70 points to end at 24,924.70.

Infosys, HCLTech, Tech Mahindra, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?The Nifty IT index surged over 6%, emerging as the top sectoral gainer on the NSE. Oracle Financial Services Software (OFSS) led the rally with a nearly 9% jump, followed by Coforge and Persistent Systems, which rose over 8% each. Blue-chip heavyweight Infosys gained close to 8%.

IndiGo takes off on D-Street with 10% jump: What's behind the rally?IndiGo's share price jumped as much as 9.78% to touch a high of Rs 5,599. By noon, the stock was trading 7.45% higher at Rs 5,479.85. With this rise, IndiGo's share price has gone up 19.35% so far in 2025.

Gold loses shine as US-China trade talks ease market jittersThe US and China ended high-stakes trade talks on a positive note on Sunday, with US officials touting a "deal" to reduce the U.S. trade deficit, while Chinese officials said they had reached an "important consensus".

Sensex surges over 3,000 points, best rally in a yearThe stock market rally was led by easing geopolitical tensions, supportive global cues, and renewed investor confidence after a sovereign credit upgrade.

IndusInd Bank faces tough questions from auditors over possible fraud: ReportSo far, IndusInd Bank has described the issue as a 'discrepancy'. This is the term it has used in its stock exchange notices and in talks with analysts and credit rating firms.

ITR Filing 2025: Opting for old tax regime? Here's why Form 10-IEA is a mustForm 10-IEA is a declaration form for those who do not want to follow the new tax regime. If you earn income from a business or profession, and you wish to continue with the old tax regime, this form is essential.

US and China pause tariff war for 90 days, to slash reciprocal duties by 115%Under the agreement, the US will reduce tariffs on Chinese goods from 145% to 30%, while China will slash its tariffs on American imports from 125% to 10%, according to a joint statement.

Dalal Street soars after ceasefire. Should you buy, hold or sell stocks?After today's euphoric rally driven by the ceasefire between India and Pakistan, investors are basking in green screens. But with uncertainty still looming, the big question remains—what should they do next?

YES Bank share price rises 9%. Here's whyThe stake sale news led to a rise in Yes Bank's stock price, making it one of the top gainers of the day. The share price of Yes Bank went up by as much as 9% during the trading session.

EPFO services simplified: Now check your PF balance with just a call or SMSBefore you use these services, make sure your Universal Account Number (UAN) is active and linked to at least one of these: your bank account, Aadhaar number or PAN. Also, your mobile number must be registered with your UAN on the EPFO portal.

Pakistan's stock exchange halts trading for an hour. Here's whyAccording to a notification from the Pakistan Stock Exchange (PSX), all equity and equity-based markets were temporarily suspended after the KSE-30 index rose more than 5% from the previous session's close — the threshold for a market halt under PSX rules.

Eternal, Adani Ports, Infosys: Top stocks as Sensex jumps over 2,000 pointsEternal (Zomato) led the gains, surging nearly 5% to become the top performer on the 30-share BSE Sensex. Other major gainers included Adani Ports, NTPC and HCLTech, all trading up more than 4%.

Will India's trade with Turkey, Azerbaijan suffer amid tensions with Pakistan?Over the years, the trade between India and Azerbaijan has grown significantly, jumping from $50 million in 2005 to $1.435 billion in 2023. Further, India imported goods worth $1.235 billion and exported products worth $201 million to Azerbaijan, according to the official data.
Pakistan stock market jumps over 9% as India ceasefire brings calmPakistan's benchmark index surged over 9% on Monday, while Dalal Street also saw gains with Sensex and Nifty jumping 3%.

Sensex, Nifty up 3% after India-Pakistan ceasefire. What should investors do?With tensions easing and markets surging, global cues and earnings looking strong, should investors ride the momentum or wait for clearer signals before taking fresh positions?

Investors add Rs 11 lakh crore on D-Street: Which stocks are driving the rally?The Sensex jumped over 2,000 points, while the Nifty came close to the 24,700 mark. The overall mood on the street was upbeat, as investors welcomed signs of calm after days of concern.

Sensex surges over 3,000 points. Why is the stock market rallying today?Stock market rally today: The BSE Sensex was up 2,975.93 points to 82,430.40 at around 3:26 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 920.50 points to trade at 24,928.50.
Sensex rallies 2,000 points; Nifty above 24,500; RIL up 3%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 1,915.43 points to 81,369.90, while the NSE Nifty50 soared 572.80 points to 24,580.20 as of 9:30 am.

Sensex, Nifty amid Indo-Pak tension: Key levels and sectors to watchForeign portfolio investors (FPIs), who had been buying stocks steadily for over two weeks, turned sellers on Friday. As per provisional exchange data, they sold shares worth Rs 3,798.71 crore.

Stock market opening: What to expect from Sensex, Nifty today?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 24,552.5 as of 8:12 am, pointing to a likely 2% jump in the Nifty 50 index compared to Friday's close of 24,008.

Stocks to watch on May 12: Swiggy, Tata Steel, Adani Power, SBIA number of companies will be in focus today due to their quarterly results or key business updates, with investors hoping for  Sensex and Nifty to resume their winning run after having lost momentum last week amid rising Indo-Pak tensions.

Explained: Why the IMF is under fire for $1 billion loan to PakistanThe disbursement, approved on Friday under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF), raises total payouts under the programme to $2.1 billion. But the timing of the announcement has provoked a fierce backlash.

India–Pakistan tensions escalate. What's next for Dalal Street investors?While the Sensex and Nifty ended over 1% lower in the previous session, experts suggest that the decline was far less than what could have been expected in such a volatile environment.

Nirmala Sitharama asks banks to stay on alert amid rising Indo-Pak tensionsThe directive comes a day after India successfully intercepted multiple missile and drone attacks launched from Pakistan late on May 8. While India reported no major damage, the government has since asked all critical institutions to bolster their cybersecurity infrastructure in anticipation of potential retaliatory attacks.
'Unsupportive stance towards India': Go Homestays ends ties with Turkish AirlinesGo Homestays ends ties with Turkish Airlines after Turkey backs Pakistan following 'Operation Sindoor'.

India-Pak tensions: Oil PSUs assure ample fuel stocks, urge against panic buyingIndian oil companies have issued statements assuring ample fuel stocks across the country. The Indian Oil Corporation and Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited have emphasised that there is no shortage of petrol, diesel, CNG, or LPG.

Bharti Airtel in talks to acquire 49% stake in Haier India: ReportSunil Mittal, the billionaire-founder of Indian telecom operator Bharti Airtel, has partnered with private equity firm, Warburg Pincus to buy a substantial stake in Haier India.

Telecom regulator recommends 5-year satellite spectrum allotment: ReportThe move comes amid growing interest in satellite internet services from global players like Elon Musk's Starlink and domestic telecom giants.
Sensex closes 880 points lower, Nifty above 24,000; Titan ends 4% upThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 880.34 points to end at 79,454.47, while the NSE Nifty50 was down by 265.80 points to close at 24,008.00.

Essential goods supply to remain unaffected across India amid geopolitical heatPrices of key food items, including pulses and vegetables, are being watched closely to make sure they stay under control. Efforts are also being made to keep the supply of these items steady across all cities.

Planning an FD in 2025? Check these 6 banks offering attractive interest ratesFor fixed deposits between 15 and 21 months, HDFC Bank is offering 7.05% to general citizens, while senior citizens get 7.55%

Finance Minister to review cyber readiness of banks, financial institutionsThe meeting will bring together representatives from several key institutions like the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), the National Stock Exchange (NSE), etc.
Explained: Why Yes Bank share price jumped over 7% todayThe Yes Bank stock has now gained nearly 11% over the past five sessions, sparking investor curiosity.

Bitcoin crosses $100,000 again, as US-UK trade deal lifts market moodThe announcement of a fresh trade deal between US President Donald Trump and UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer helped lift market mood across sectors and gave crypto investors an added reason to feel positive.

YES Securities raises Paytm target to Rs 975 on profitability turnaround and surge in merchant lendingContribution margin rises to 56.1%, EBITDA turns positive before ESOP costs, and merchant loan volumes gain traction under DLG model.

Equity mutual fund inflows hit 1-year low in April amid tariff worries, says AMFIIndia's equity mutual fund inflows eased for a fourth month in April, dropping to Rs 242.69 billion, the weakest level in a year, reveals AMFI data.

Sensex tumbles 800 points: Why is the stock market falling today?The BSE Sensex was trading 722.62 points lower at 79,612.19 around 11:57 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 221.05 points to trade barely above 24,000. Most of the broader market indices also fell during the trading session as volatility surged due to the ongoing military escalations.

entertainment.headline: Bhuvan Bam shuts down Pakistani user's 'unfollow' remark with bold replyActor Bhuvan Bam reacted to a Pakistani user who wrote about unfollowing him on social media. This came amid India-Pakistan tensions.

Ibrahim Ali Khan opens up about his battle with speech and hearing difficultiesIbrahim Ali Khan recently revealed that a severe case of jaundice at birth impacted his brainstem and led to hearing and speech difficulties.

Kannada actor Upendra joins Ram Pothineni and Bhagyashree Borse for RAPO 22Makers of 'RAPO 22', Mythri Movie Makers, shared a poster revealing Kannada superstar Upendra, of 'UI' fame, as a part of their film. The film stars Ram Pothineni and Bhagyashree Borse.

Ibrahim Ali Khan recalls Saif's emotional words after knife attack: Made me weepActor Ibrahim Ali Khan spoke about the tough time after his father Saif Ali Khan, was stabbed. He said that the incident brought them closer as a family.

Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Tamil Li'l Champs Season 4 winner is DivineshThe grand finale of the Tamil reality show Sa Re Ga Ma Pa Li'l Champs Season 4 concluded with 11-year-old contestant Divinesh from Chennai being declared the winner. Amaran actor Sivakarthikeyan presented the trophy.
Mika Singh says he'll publicly slap KRK after his diss videoSinger Mika Singh has reacted to Kamaal R Khan's critical video, warning that he'll slap him the next time they meet.

Rajinikanth joins Jailer 2 shoot in Kozhikode, welcomed with Hukum songSuperstar Rajinikanth begins shooting for Nelson Dilipkumar's 'Jailer 2' in Kerala. In a viral video, he is seen being welcomed with the iconic 'Hukum' track.

They Call Him OG shoot resumes in Andhra, Pawan Kalyan expected to join soonAfter months of uncertainty, 'They Call Him OG' is finally in works. Actor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan is expected to join the shoot soon.

Naatu Naatu is an ode to Chiranjeevi and Balakrishna, says Jr NTRAt a recent RRR concert at London's Royal Albert Hall, Jr NTR spoke about the emotional roots of the Oscar-winning track 'Naatu Naatu', calling it a tribute to dance legends Chiranjeevi and Balakrishna.

One Piece episode 1128 takes over the internet, fans call it 'insane'The latest One Piece episode 1128 has taken the anime world by storm with stunning animation and gripping storytelling, reaffirming its legendary status. Meanwhile, read details about when episode 1129 will be out.

Adivi Sesh shares special post for 'brother from another mother' Nani with BTS picsAdivi Sesh and Nani recently shared screen space in the Telugu thriller 'HIT: The Third Case'. Two weeks into its theatrical run, on Monday, Sesh shared a series of BTS pictures with his co-star, sharing his admiration for him.

BTS' Jin teases Echo album and announces solo tour datesBTS' Jin has unveiled a teaser for his second solo album Echo, exciting fans worldwide. His upcoming solo tour signals a new chapter ahead of BTS' full-group reunion this year.

Rajinikanth called Tourist Family director Abishan Jeevinth 'extraordinary'Debutant director Abishan Jeevinth's 'Tourist Family', starring Sasikumar and Simran, has been gathering applause since its release. Superstar Rajinikanth is the latest to join the club, calling the film "super and extraordinary".

India at Cannes 2025 with Aishwarya, Alia, and Payal Kapadia in spotlightIndia will make a significant presence at Cannes 2025 with celebrated actors and filmmakers. This participation highlights artistic achievements amid eased India-Pakistan tensions.

Javed Akhtar feels Bollywood stays silent about government due to fear of raidsJaved Akhtar stated that many Bollywood celebrities avoid criticising the government due to fear of raids and investigations by agencies like the Enforcement Directorate (ED) and Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI). He emphasised that while stars may appear privileged, they share the same fears as ordinary citizens in today's political climate.

Anushka Sharma on Virat's Test cricket retirement: You've earned every bit of thisActor Anushka Sharma reacted to husband Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket on May 12. The 36-year-old cricketer announced his retirement through a statement on social media, concluding a remarkable 14-year career that stretched from 2011 to 2025.

Roses and balloons: Vignesh Shivan shares Nayanthara's Mother's Day momentsVignesh Shivan shared a bunch of photos of his wife-actor Nayanthara with their twins, Uyir and Ulag. The filmmaker posted a heartfelt note to wish the actor on the special occasion.

Prateik Patil didn't invite father Raj Babbar to his wedding 'to respect mother'Actor Prateik Smita Patil finally opened up about not inviting his father Raj Babbar to his wedding. He explained that he wanted to respect his late mother, Smita Patil.

SRK worked 36 hours straight on Circus, reveals co-star Renuka ShahaneRenuka Shahane recalled how Shah Rukh Khan worked tirelessly for 36 hours straight during the shoot of 'Circus.' She also shared a valuable piece of advice SRK gave her, which helped her overcome her fears on set.

general news.headline: PM Modi to address nation shortly amid Operation Sindoor Live UpdatesThis will be Prime Minister Narendra Modi's first address to the nation after India launched Operation Sindoor on May 7 to destroy nine terror infrastructures in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir (POK).

Stopped India-Pak nuclear war, told them 'gonna do a lot of trade with you': TrumpDonald Trump said that the US administration played a key role in brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan, asserting that his approach to diplomacy through trade pressure helped avert what he described as a potentially "bad nuclear war."

Pak General has been lying blatantly. Here is evidence he can't denyEven during a military conflict, one does not expect a top-ranking army officer in uniform to conduct an official press conference and present doctored clips to prove a point.

Cash at Justice Verma's home 'disappeared' before probe, staff behind it: SourcesA Supreme Court-appointed in-house enquiry committee confirmed the recovery of cash from the residence of Justice Yashwant Varma, who was serving as a judge of the Delhi High Court, following a fire incident on March 14.

What the world thinks of India-Pak ceasefireIndia and Pakistan, which were locked in a war-like confrontation for three days, announced a surprise understanding to cease fire. How did the global media read the ceasefire and what did it say? This analysis gives us an understanding of the minds of the US, China and the Middle East.

India, Pakistan military officials speak on hotline, discuss ceasefire: SourcesTop military operations officials from New Delhi and Islamabad spoke on a hotline days after India conducted Operation Sindoor to destroy nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied-Kashmir (POK).

PM Modi's speech amid Operation Sindoor, India-Pak ceasefire shortlyPM Modi Speech on Operation Sindoor Live Update: Amid heightened tensions between India and Pakistan, Prime Minister Narendra Modi will address the nation at 8 pm today. His speech comes days after over 100 terrorists were killed under Operation Sindoor, India's precision strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and POK in response to the deadly Pahalgam terror attack. Earlier today, India blamed Pakistan for the ceasefire violation hours after Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri announced that both countries had reached an understanding to stop all firings and military actions on land, air and sea with immediate effect. The situation along the LoC and International Border is stable now.

What are Pak's Kirana Hills, why they came up in India's tri-services briefing?The Director General of India's Air Operations, Air Marshal AK Bharti, rejected the buzz that Kairana Hills in Pakistan had been hit as part of India's Operation Sindoor. Kirana Hills, a fortified defence area in Pakistan's Punjab, is said to house a part of Pakistan's nuclear arsenal. Here's more about Kirana Hills and Air Marshal Bharti's smile.

Opinion: The disgrace of trolling Vikram MisriAn official carries out his duty, a policy decision is announced, and a digital lynch mob descends. This time, the target was Vikram Misri, India's Foreign Secretary, a man who has served the nation with distinction for over three decades. His crime? Announcing a "mutual understanding" to stop fire or the ceasefire.

'Without fear...': Air Marshal quotes Ramcharitmanas at Operation Sindoor briefingAir Marshal Awadhesh Kumar Bharti invoked a verse from Ramdhari Singh Dinkar's rendering of the Ramcharitmanas to support India's retaliatory strikes, saying persistent provocations from Pakistan demanded a firm response.

'Guardian of skies': India shows wreckage of Pak Mirage jet it downedThe announcement of the Pakistani Mirage jet being shot down during Operation Sindoor was made by the senior officials of the Indian armed forces during a joint press briefing earlier today.

Ashes to ashes: Army official likens India air defence to lethal Lillee-Thomson duoTo explain the power and precision of the air defence system, Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai mentioned how Australian bowlers Jeff Thomson and Dennis Lillee diminished the English batting line-up during a 1970s match.

Anushka Sharma on Virat's Test cricket retirement: You've earned every bit of thisActor Anushka Sharma reacted to husband Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket on May 12. The 36-year-old cricketer announced his retirement through a statement on social media, concluding a remarkable 14-year career that stretched from 2011 to 2025.

Pak tries to pass off LeT commander at terrorists' funeral as 'cleric, family man'A viral image showed a man leading terrorists' funeral prayers in LeT headquarters of Muridke. Indian officials identified the man as Hafiz Abdur Rauf, a senior Lashkar figure and US-designated global terrorist.

Close-up of giant crater shows how India rained hellfire on critical Pak airbaseThe Rahim Yar Khan airbase is a vital military installation for Pakistan. The giant crater appears to span a large section of the airstrip, preventing any immediate aircraft operations.

Why India pounding Pak airbases sent it into panic mode, causing US to step inThe impact of India's missile strikes on Pakistani airbases reverberated through Islamabad. By the evening of May 10, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio had reached out to Pakistan's Army Chief and India's S Jaishankar. According to sources, Rubio relayed that Pakistan was ready for a ceasefire.

Emmanuel Macron, Keir Starmer caught on cam at alleged cocaine party? Here's the truthA viral video sparked claims that French President Emmanuel Macron hid a cocaine pouch during the Ukraine visit. The French media debunked the rumour, calling it an "absurd conspiracy" and confirming the object was just a handkerchief.

Army official's Virat Kohli mention at Op Sindoor briefing: My favourite playerBefore illustrating the effectiveness of India's air defence systems with a cricket analogy, Lieutenant General Rajiv Ghai took a moment during a DRDO press briefing to speak about Virat Kohli's retirement from Test cricket.

Missing Padma Shri scientist Subbanna Ayyappan found dead in Cauvery RiverRenowned agricultural scientist Dr Subbanna Ayyappan, reported missing since May 7, was found dead in the Cauvery River. Police have launched an investigation.

'Drunk' man drowns in pool at Lucknow water park, family alleges foul playA 20-year-old man drowned in a swimming pool at Lucknow's Marino Water Park. Police said that he was intoxicated while the victim's family alleged foul play.

Where does Virat Kohli, India's greatest, stand among the best Test captains?Virat Kohli is India's most successful Test captain, with 40 wins from the 68 matches he led. But where does he rank among the greatest skippers Test cricket has ever seen?

India's fight against terrorists, pity Pak chose to intervene: Air MarshalAir Marshal AK Bharti on Monday, while addressing a media briefing, said that India's fight was against terrorists, and added that it was a pity that Pakistan chose to intervene.

'Ready to attack': Baloch rebels hit 51 locations in Pakistan as tensions mountThe Baloch Liberation Army (BLA) took responsibility for more than 51 attacks on Pakistani forces. The BLA urges the world, especially India, to support efforts to stop Pakistan's terrorism and prevent nuclear risks.

Virat Kohli retires: Sachin Tendulkar tells untold story in emotional tributeSachin Tendulkar paid an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli, recalling a heartfelt gesture when he retired from international cricket after the Mumbai Test against West Indies in 2013.

sports.headline: Gill to Jaiswal: How India's NextGen reacted to Virat Kohli's Test retirementFrom Shubman Gill to Nitish Kumar Reddy, the next generation of Indian cricket paid glowing tribute to Virat Kohli after the star batter retired from Tests. "A true torchbearer who renewed our love for Test cricket," Reddy wrote, capturing the impact Kohli had on the format.

Virat Kohli retires: An ode to a Test captain and player who did things his wayVirat Kohli leaves Test cricket as one of the greatest batters for India in the format and as their best captain. Throughout his career, Kohli did one thing only – he played the game his way.

Virat Kohli's India instilled fear in opposition: Karthik on batter's legacyVirat Kohli has retired from Test cricket, ending an era of intense leadership and batting excellence. Dinesh Karthik speaks on the legacy that the batter leaves behind.

Mohammed Siraj's tribute to 'superhero' Virat Kohli wins heart from Anushka SharmaFast bowler Mohammed Siraj wrote an emotional tribute to Virat Kohli after the former captain retired from Test cricket on Monday, May 12. Siraj played eight Tests under Kohli's captaincy and played a key role in the famous win at Lord's in 2021.

Former Pakistan coach joins Bangladesh as pace bowling coachBangladesh roped in Shaun Tait as their pace bowling coach before the two-match T20I series against the United Arab Emirates (UAE) to be held from May 17.

CAB drapes Eden Gardens in banner in salute to armed forcesThe Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) paid tribute to the Indian armed forces by displaying a large banner on the Eden Gardens clubhouse. education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
